abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Poverty Reduction Support
            Credit for Benin will support the implementation of
            Benin's Poverty Reduction Strategy and to strengthen
            the government's capacity to design and carry out its
            own development and poverty reduction programs. The
            potential adverse environmental and social effects are
            associated mainly with the rural/semi-urban water supply
            activities, the health sector interventions, the investment
            in rural roads, the implementation of the forest management
            schemes, and the intensification of agricultural production,
            including cotton production. While the drilling of wells may
            only have minimal adverse impact on the physical
            environment, the use of water sources and the maintenance of
            their surroundings could generate environmental effects
            stemming from the lack of adequate hygiene and the spread of
            water-borne disease. The mismanagement and inadequate
            disposal of medical and biomedical wastes are also the
            source of substantial public health risks. Mitigation
            measures will include: Mandatory full EIA for dam; avoid
            unsanitary sites, control of wastewater and mud around
            wells; sensitization of users on hygiene, and imposing
            restrictions on the distance between wells and latrines.
            Measures will continue to be enforced during the
            implementation of the rural water supply.
